Identification.LongTitle: A second Act to implement certain provisions of the budget tabled in Parliament on March 22, 2017 and other measures

Provision.Text: Her Majesty, by and with the advice and consent of the Senate and House of Commons of Canada, enacts as follows:

Section.Text: This Act may be cited as the Budget Implementation Act, 2017, No. 2.

Heading.Label: PART 1
Heading.TitleText: Amendments to the Income Tax Act and to Related Legislation
Regulations Amending the Income Tax Regulations (Omnibus, No. 3)

Heading.Label: PART 2
Heading.TitleText: Amendments to the Excise Tax Act and to Related Legislation (GST/HST Measures)

TitleText.XRefExternal: Bretton Woods and Related Agreements Act
Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank Agreement Act

Section.Text: The Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank Agreement Act, whose text is as follows and whose schedule is set out in the schedule to this Act, is enacted:
Section.Note: [See Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank Agreement Act]

Section.Text: In this Division, Agreements means the following agreements, as amended from time to time:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the Administration Agreement for the Financial Support of the Private Sector Window of the Global Agriculture and Food Security Program (TFC-3), entered into between Her Majesty the Queen in right of Canada, as represented by the Minister of Finance, and the International Finance Corporation on March 14, 2011;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the Administration Agreement for the Financial Support of the Financial Mechanisms for Climate Change (FMCC) Facility — Concessional Finance (TFC-4), entered into between Her Majesty the Queen in right of Canada, as represented by the Minister of Finance, and the International Finance Corporation on March 8, 2011; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the Administration Agreement for the Financial Support of the Financial Mechanisms for Climate (FMCC) Change Facility — Technical Assistance (TF 071589) entered into between Her Majesty the Queen in right of Canada, as represented by the Minister of Finance, and the International Finance Corporation on March 8, 2011.

Subsection.Text: The Minister of Foreign Affairs is responsible for the Agreements.

For the purposes of section 90 of the Financial Administration Act, shares of a corporation that, on acquisition, would be held by, on behalf of or in trust for the Crown may be acquired in the course of the administration of the Agreements.

Section.Text: This Division comes into force on a day to be fixed by order of the Governor in Council.

Footnote.Text: [Note: Division 3 in force March 27, 2018, see SI/2018-29.]

Heading.TitleText: Consequential Amendments to the Payment Clearing and Settlement Act
Related Amendments to the Canada Deposit Insurance Corporation Act

Text.Repealed: [Repealed before coming into force, 2018, c. 27, s. 513]

Subsection.Text: Sections 195 to 204 and 210 to 214 come into force on a day to be fixed by order of the Governor in Council.

Footnote.Text: [Note: Sections 195 to 204 and 210 to 214 in force September 1, 2019, see SI/2019-31.]

Subsection.Text: Sections 205 to 209 come into force on a day to be fixed by order of the Governor in Council.

Footnote.Text: [Note: Section 205 repealed before coming into force, see 2018, c. 27, s. 513; sections 206 to 209 in force September 1, 2019, see SI/2019-31.]

Heading.Label: DIVISION 10
Heading.TitleText: Trade within Canada and Harmonization of Energy Efficiency Requirements

TitleText.XRefExternal: Canadian Free Trade Agreement Implementation Act

Section.Text: The Canadian Free Trade Agreement Implementation Act is enacted as follows:
Section.Note: [See Canadian Free Trade Agreement Implementation Act]

Heading.TitleText: Related Amendments to the Energy Efficiency Act

TitleText.XRefExternal: Department of Public Works and Government Services Act

Section.Text: The Timber Marking Act, chapter T-11 of the Revised Statutes of Canada, 1985, is repealed.
The Agreement on Internal Trade Implementation Act, chapter 17 of the Statutes of Canada, 1996, is repealed.
This Division is deemed to have come into force on July 1, 2017.

Subsection.Text: Sections 230, 232 to 236, 239, 252, 253 and 255 to 258 come into force on a day to be fixed by order of the Governor in Council.

Footnote.Text: [Note: Sections 230, 232 to 236, 239, 252, 253 and 255 to 258 in force October 1, 2018, see SI/2018-83.]

Subsection.Text: Sections 237, 238 and 240 to 251 come into force on a day to be fixed by order of the Governor in Council.

Footnote.Text: [Note: Sections 237, 238 and 240 to 251 in force April 12, 2019, see SI/2019-19.]

TitleText.XRefExternal: Business Development Bank of Canada Act

Schedule.Note: [See Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank Agreement Act]
